results.title: Once upon a mouse
results.creator_credit: Gary Rocklen, Jerry Kramer and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Excerpts from animated features, cartoon shorts and still photography are combined for a nostalgic montage of unusual beauty and emotional impact. The film segments a wide variety of Disney animated features, such as music, love, villains and happy endings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Rocklen, Jerry Kramer and Walt Disney Animation Studios

results.title: Once upon a midnight scary
results.creator_credit: Neil Cox, Paul Asselin and Diane Asselin
results.brief_description: Welcome to the eerie library of Vincent Price, journey with him into a world of ghosts, ghouls and “things that go bump in the night”. The Master of macabre has conjured up a reading of classic and contemporary ghost stories that are vividly brought to life. There is mystery and wonder in these three famous tales of the supernatural. In Richard Peck’s “The Ghost Belonged to Me”, meet 13 year old Alexander, a farmboy who discovers he has his very own ghost! And see Ichabod Crane from Washington Irving’s classic “The Legend of Sleepy Hollow”, who doesn’t believe in ghosts - until the Headless Horseman takes his last ride. Then there’s John Bellair’s “The House With a Clock in its Walls”, where a doctor and his nephew race against an evil spirit to find a clock before it destroys the world.

results.title: Once upon a hunt [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Francis Mankiewicz, Pierre Gauvreau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This feature film is the story of three men and a boy who leave the city for the bush and a three-day hunt. For the hunters escaping the routine of daily life and work, the hunt is a move towards freedom. And above all, it is a chance to prove their virility in conquering the wild. Their attempts end in failure and tragedy. Cast includes Monique Mercure, Francoise Berd, Marcel Sabourin, Frederique Collin, Pierre Dufresne. Preview before screening for a general audience. Dubbed English version. (Award: Toronto)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Mankiewicz, Pierre Gauvreau and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Once upon a forest [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Charles Grosvenor, Jerry Mills, David Kirschner, HTV Cymbu Wales, Zotic Fox and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: Dapplewood is a magical place. One day three Furling friends, Abagail the wood mouse, Edgar the mole and Russell the hedgehog find their lives seriously disrupted. A chemical spill threatens Dapplewood and their young friend Michelle becomes seriously ill from the toxic fumes. The three friends use the skills they learned from their teacher Cornelius and embark on an exciting journey to find help for their friend. From the famous Hanna-Barbera studios.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Grosvenor, Jerry Mills, David Kirschner, HTV Cymbu Wales, Zotic Fox and Hanna-Barbera Productions

results.title: Once Upon a Cheese
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Kestrel Film Productions and Hugh Stuckey
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at the cheese industry in Australia today. Shows how cheese is made by a fully automated process. Points out that special factories have been set up to produce cheddar. Lists the different types of cheeses - all of which are now available in Australia. Touches upon the varieties to be used with wines and beer, in cooking and how to store cheese at home.

results.title: Once there were bluebirds
results.creator_credit: Dick Van Bentham and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live-action to acquaint children with the beauty of nature and the ecological problems caused by the encroachments of modern society. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: On Your Own (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Teach your children safety measures and self-care skills for times when they are home alone and show them how to confront their fears. The film stresses the need for communication between parent and child, and encourages children to view being alone as a positive, rewarding experience.

results.title: On your own
results.brief_description: Explores the wide range of practical subjects covered in the education curriculum for high schools and junior colleges. Some of the many subjects covered include comparative shopping, home ownership vs renting, baking low cost bread, repairing old furniture, credit and money management, family relations, operating a child care centre on campus, and other pertinent studies. Student response is evident in lively group discussions and in scenes filmed in the actual classroom.

results.title: On your marks...
results.brief_description: In October 1981 (twelve months before the Commonwealth Games) test trials were held in Brisbane. This film is a montage of those trial events.

results.title: On your marks it's bright sparks. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Mark Lamprell, Jeff Gale and Pru Donovan
results.brief_description: Planes, Trains, Boats and Cars: Sparky, Amy and Alex discover floating bikes, underwater boats, trucks without drivers, trains without trucks, cars that become boats and planes that become helicopters. But can Alex really turn his BMX bike into an excavator to drill a hole to China? “Water, Water, Everywhere”: Planet Earth should be called Planet Water says Sparky, as he flies Amy and Alex around the world to see why. From the Amazon River to the River Nile and even Antarctica, Amy and Alex see how water is a wonderful gift - to be used, enjoyed and shared by everyone.
